result.execSummary:
The defendant Clifton A Matthews was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
STAYED.
With Huber. Standard release conditions.
14 days credit, if revoked.
Probation may be transferred to Milwaukee County.

miscConds.notes:
Court costs and DNA surcharge to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Submit to an AODA Assessment and follow through with any  treatment recommended.

Attend Anger Management.
Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent.
Case 15CM1988 was dismissed and read into: 15CM1611.

records.addlTxt: Notice of Case Status Change - Revoked - Sentenced to Jail/HOC.  Wis. Dept. of Corrections notice of case status change received.  Outstanding financial obligations have been converted to a civil judgment.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant to have no contact with bar/residence on Grove St listed in the Criminal Complaint.  Defendant is not to have any violent contact with Renee A.   Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.

Defendant Clifton A Matthews in court, in custody.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Adam Schleis appears as friend of the court.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.  Hearing scheduled for October 30, 2015 at 10:30 am.
Waukesha County Pretrial Screening Services Report by Wisconsin Community Services filed.
Attorney Eryn M Menden in court.   Defendant Clifton A Matthews did not appear.   Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case called at 11:39 am.

Attorney Eryn M Menden in court.   Defendant Clifton A Matthews did not appear.   Andrea M. Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel is requesting adjournment. Court grants.   Court ordered a capias stayed until next court date.  Hearing scheduled for October 7, 2015 at 09:30 am.

Defendant to have no contact with Soomers Saloon in the village of Eagle as listed in the criminal complaint.  Defendant is to not have any contact with the residence of 322 Grove St in the village of Eagle, he can return to the residence one time with law enforcement to obtain personal items.  Defendant is not to have any violent contact with Renee A. as long as she consents.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.

Defendant Clifton A Matthews in court, in custody, with attorney Mark E. Kershek on behalf of the Public Defender's office.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.   Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for September 28, 2015 at 09:30 am.
